title: Python -List Methods

metadata.description: Learn about Python -List Methods with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
List Methods
Python has a set of built-in methods that you can use on lists.
Method
Description
append()
Adds an element at 
  the end of the list
clear()
Removes all the 
  elements from the list
copy()
Returns a copy of the 
  list
count()
Returns the number of 
  elements with the specified value
extend()
Add the elements of a 
  list (or any iterable), to the end of the current list
index()
Returns the index of 
  the first element with the specified value
insert()
Adds an element at 
  the specified position
pop()
Removes the element at the 
  specified position
remove()
Removes the  
  item with the specified value
reverse()
Reverses the order 
  of the list
sort()
Sorts the list

★
+1
